thread.title: Tonquin Road remains closed in Sherwood after truck hits power pole
thread.title_full: Tonquin Road remains closed in Sherwood after truck hits power pole | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Tonquin Road remains closed in Sherwood after truck hits power pole
text:
Southwest Tonquin Road in Sherwood remains closed Friday evening as crews repair a power pole knocked down by a delivery truck.
At about 4:20 p.m. on Friday, Washington County Sheriff's Office responded to a single vehicle crash at Southwest Tonquin Road east of Southwest Oregon Street. A refrigerated delivery truck owned by Columbia Empire Meat Company had crashed into a power pole. The driver, 43-year-old Joseph Ely, was still trapped inside.
Tualatin Valley Fire and Rescue firefighters, Sherwood police officers and sheriff's deputies "could not approach the truck because there were power lines lying across it," Sgt. David Thompson, with the sheriff's office, wrote in a news release. "A crew from Portland General Electric responded quickly and was able to cut power to the lines."
Ely, of Sherwood, told deputies that he lost control of his truck at a curve before he hit the pole. He sustained minor injuries and was treated at the scene.
Authorities did not cite Ely for the crash.
